extendedIngredients.name: tamarind paste
extendedIngredients.original: 1/4 cup tamarind paste (found in Asian markets)

title: Grilled Shrimp With Spicy Tamarind Dipping Sauce
summary: Grilled Shrimp With Spicy Tamarind Dipping Sauce is a gluten free, dairy free, and pescatarian recipe with 8 servings. One portion of this dish contains roughly 8g of protein, 4g of fat, and a total of 108 calories. For $1.11 per serving, this recipe covers 6% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 14 people found this recipe to be flavorful and satisfying. A mixture of canolan oil, tamarind paste, tamarind paste, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so yummy. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 5 minutes. It will be a hit at your The Fourth Of July event. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 29%. This score is rather bad. Similar recipes include Cajun Grilled Shrimp with Spicy Dipping Sauce, Grilled Shrimp with Tamarind Sauce, and Coconut Shrimp with Spicy Mango Dipping Sauce.

winePairing.pairingText: Pinot Grigio, Riesling, and Sauvignon Blanc are great choices for Shrimp. These crisp white wines work well with shrimp prepared in a variety of ways, whether grilled, fried, or in garlic sauce. One wine you could try is Menage a Trois Limelight Pinot Grigio. It has 4.5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 11 dollars.

productMatches.title: Menage a Trois Limelight Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Ménage à Trois Limelight shines a spotlight on refreshing citrus flavors in the most dazzling way. Limelight is a new star with sexy orange blossom aromas that lead to zesty key lime and mouthwatering Granny Smith apple flavors that make you pucker up. A touch of honeysuckle sweetness and minerality balance the pronounced citrus notes before the curtains drop with a refreshingly crisp finish.

instructions: Heat grill on high. Thread 3 shrimp on each skewer; season with salt and pepper. Dipping sauce: Mix remaining ingredients in a bowl. Grill shrimp until cooked through, about 3 minutes per side. Serve with dipping sauce on the side.Heat grill on high. Thread 3 shrimp on each skewer; season with salt and pepper. Dipping sauce: Mix remaining ingredients in a bowl. Grill shrimp until cooked through, about 3 minutes per side. Serve with dipping sauce on the side.
